t: Clean water in the Amazon
s: November 14, 2022 - For more than half-a-century indigenous peoples of Ecuador’s northern Amazon have lived downriver from Ecuador’s largest oil fields. With the rivers and creeks contaminated, families were forced to either bathe and drink from unsafe sources, or travel long distances to find clean spring water.
